natlang.rdg.documentplanner
Class BackgroundInformationSupplier

java.lang.Object
  natlang.rdg.documentplanner.BackgroundInformationSupplier
public class BackgroundInformationSupplier
extends java.lang.Object

The BackgroundInformationSupplier is responsible for adding background information to the document plan and adding necessary discourse markers. In onder to achieve this it uses a discourse history and a history containing the entities already mentioned. Furthermore it uses the character history to get an entity's name.

addMessage

public void addMessage(PlotElement pe,
                       PlotElement pe2,
                       boolean after)
Adds a plot element representing background information to another plot element (by an elaboration relation) and adds this to the graph

Parameters:
pe - the original plot element
pe2 - the plot element representing the background information
after - a boolean indicating whether the background information should be added before or after the other plot element

removeMessage

public void removeMessage(PlotElement pe)
Removes node from document plan (is somewhat strange, but is the same as the function in initialdocumentplanbuilder)

Parameters:
pe - the node to be removed

reset

public void reset()
This method is needed when the story has been split into paragraphs. If a document plan has to be shown, the graph has to be destroyed afterwards. Therefore the graph has to be reconstructed, so in order to use the correct discourse history and entity history these histories are reset to the ones used at the beginning of the paragraph.

endParagraph

public void endParagraph()
This method is needed when the story has been split into paragraphs. If a document plan has to be shown, the graph has to be destroyed afterwards. Therefore the graph has to be reconstructed, so in order to use the correct discourse history and entity history the temporary variables are set to the current variables.
